js
Class JSPopover

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      js.JSPopover
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class JSPopover
extends javax.swing.JFrame

JSPopover is designed to recreate the popover UI element from the iPad interface. It consists of an always-on-top frame which has an arrow on one side, usually used to point to the component that caused the popover to display.

See Also:
Serialized Form

JSPopover

public JSPopover()
Creates a new popover in the vertical direction (arrow pointing up).

JSPopover

public JSPopover(int direction)
Creates a new popover in the specified direction, either JSPopover.VERTICAL for an upward-pointing arrow, or JSPopover.HORIZONTAL for a left-pointing arrow.

Parameters:
direction - an integer representing the direction for the arrow to point.

toggleDirection

public void toggleDirection()
Changes the arrow to point in the other direction to its current one, i.e. if the arrow is currently pointing up it will change to pointing left and vice versa.

setDirection

public void setDirection(int direction)
Sets the direction for the arrow to point in, either JSPopover.VERTICAL for an upward-pointing arrow, or JSPopover.HORIZONTAL for a left-pointing arrow.

Parameters:
direction - an integer representing the direction for the arrow to point.
